thread.title: Media Alert: Red Hat CEO Jim Whitehurst to Keynote All Things Open Conference
thread.title_full: Media Alert: Red Hat CEO Jim Whitehurst to Keynote All Things Open Conference

title: Media Alert: Red Hat CEO Jim Whitehurst to Keynote All Things Open Conference
text:
[October 15, 2015] Media Alert: Red Hat CEO Jim Whitehurst to Keynote All Things Open Conference 
Red Hat ( News - Alert ), Inc. (NYSE: RHT), the world's leading provider of open source software solutions, today announced that President and CEO Jim Whitehurst will serve as a keynote speaker at the All Things Open Conference , taking place in Raleigh, N.C., October 19-20. 
The All Things Open conference will feature discussions on innovative technologies using open source software. Whitehurst's keynote will address the cultural changes taking place in many organizations today. Drawing from points made in his book, The Open Organization: Igniting Passion and Performance , he will speak to the benefits of having an open organization that encourages passion, fuels creativity, and catalyzes direction. 
Whitehurst will be speaking Oct. 19, 2015, at 9:15 a.m. EST, at the Raleigh Convention Center . For more information about the event, or to register for the 2015 All Things Open Conference, visit the All Things Open website. 
About Red Hat, Inc. 
Red Hat is the word's leading provider of open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to reliable and high-performing cloud, Linux, middleware, storage and virtualization technologies. Red Hat also offers award-winning support, training, and consulting services. As a connective hub in a global network of enterprises, partners, and open source communities, Red Hat helps create relevant, innovative technologies that liberate resources for growth and prepare customers for the future of IT. Learn more at http://www.redhat.com . 
Forward-Looking Statements

The forward-looking statements included in this press release represent the Company's views as of the date of this press release and these views could change.
